body:
### Describe the bug

PEP-669 (https://peps.python.org/pep-0669/) and its implementation in https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/103083 change the internals of CPython's tracing in Py3.12. We need to adapt. Currently, profiling fails in Py3.12.

Compilation was already fixed in https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/03c498d3142ccee2da258c540e96f12c863159fc (#5450), but that doesn't make the feature work again.

Test failure:

<details>

```
======================================================================
FAIL: pstats_profile_test ()
Doctest: pstats_profile_test
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.12.0-beta.1/x64/lib/python3.12/doctest.py", line 2228, in runTest
    raise self.failureException(self.format_failure(new.getvalue()))
AssertionError: Failed doctest test for pstats_profile_test
  File "/home/runner/work/cython/cython/TEST_TMP/6/run/c/pstats_profile_test/pstats_profile_test.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line 1, in pstats_profile_test

----------------------------------------------------------------------
File "/home/runner/work/cython/cython/TEST_TMP/6/run/c/pstats_profile_test/pstats_profile_test.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", line 8, in pstats_profile_test
Failed example:
    short_stats['f_def']
Exception raised:

      File "<doctest pstats_profile_test[5]>", line 1, in <module>

        ~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^
    KeyError: 'f_def'
----------------------------------------------------------------------

      File "<doctest pstats_profile_test[6]>", line 1, in <module>

        ~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^

----------------------------------------------------------------------
```

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

_No response_

current master (3.0.0b3)

_No response_

comment_data.body: Detail tags and triple backticks need to be separated by a newline for the rendering to not be broken.
Is there a chance that this could be in before the final release of 3.12? Also will this functionality be restored for 0.2.x version?

> Is there a chance that this could be in before the final release of 3.12?

If someone repairs it in time, then yes. Investigations and/or PR is welcome.

Basically, someone has to figure out how tracing can be done in Python 3.12 now. The CPython project broke their C-API, so they probably have a (documented?) idea somewhere how to migrate.


> will this functionality be restored for 0.2.x version?

This is out of scope for future 0.29.x releases. We could add an explicit C warning there, though, when users try to use tracing in Py3.12. You can use Python 3.11 for profiling/tracing with 0.29.x.

Quote from @da-woods in https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5813

Profiling on Py3.12+ is currently broken. Here are my notes from looking into it:

* `PyEval_SetProfile` is now "legacy". It still works, and I believe Cython would still interact correctly with it if it were used. However, the standard library profile modules don't use it.
* The current preferred way is via [`sys.monitoring`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/sys.monitoring.html#module-sys.monitoring), and this is what profile/cProfile do.
* `PyEval_SetProfile` sets up functions using the new "monitoring" approach, however, things that use the new "monitoring" approach don't trigger the old `PyEval_SetProfile` way. Therefore, if we want to interact with all profiling tools we really need to use the new "monitoring" approach.
* I think the right thing to do would be to call [`_Py_call_instrumentation`](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/fa84e5fe0a3bd8e77c33b20867d71ac6bee270f9/Python/instrumentation.c#L1035C1) (or something similar). Unfortunately these are internal symbols so fail at the link stage (even if include the internal headers).
* There doesn't seem to be an easy way to check if profiling is enabled. However, `_Py_call_instrumentation` looks to return very quickly if it isn't, so I think that's OK.
* The linking errors are largely where I got stuck - there doesn't seem to be any accessible way to trigger a profiling event manually.
I created https://github.com/python/cpython/issues/111997 for designing a new signalling C-API in CPython.

My proposal for now is just to remove the test from Python 3.12: https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/5815.

I suspect if people really needed to profile Cython+Python 3.12 they could cprofile/profile from Python 3.11 and it'd work (because they'd use the "legacy" method). But I don't think that's something we should provide ourself.

title: [BUG] Profiling/tracing fails in Py3.12
